results.title: By the seats of their pants
results.brief_description: When pilot Dick Scobee blasted off aboard the ill-fated Challenger space shuttle, he took with him a unique piece of Australia’s aviation history: a rib from Bert Hinkler’s glider. As Dick’s widow June recounts this same piece was miraculously recovered floating in the ocean amongst the Challenger debris. This programme is a fascinating look at Australia’s aviators. From pioneers such as Sir Charles Kingsford Smith, Charles Ulm and Lores Bonney, through to the pilots of both World Wars and Vietnam, to the barnstorming antics of today’s airmen and women. Experience the thrills of cattle mustering by helicopter in Australia’s wild outback, spectacular aerobatics in a rugged Pitt Special, the life-saving endeavours of the Royal Flying Doctor Service and low-level manoevres by cropduster adventurers. It is a first-hand account from the pilots who were and still are flying ‘by the seats of their pants’.

results.brief_description: A series of animated, cautionary tales show the legal and financial traps waiting for the unwary consumer.

results.title: Buyer beware
results.creator_credit: Peter Green, Vincent O'Donnell, Rednose Revival and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An animated look at the perils inherent in signing a contract which considers such familiar situations as buying a second-hand car, building a house, and purchasing household goods. Points out the need for full awareness of the conditions of sale before signing by highlighting the headaches that await the foolish consumer. Narrated by Max Gillies. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Butterfly botanists
results.brief_description: This film shows students the life process of a typical butterfly, the monarch butterfly, stressing the dependence of the larvae on plant food, the stages of development of the various species and their methods of hibernating and, finally, the economic importance of all butterflies. Suitable for primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Butterfly
results.brief_description: This film uses environmental sounds and close-up photography to follow the development of the insect as it goes through the stages from egg to butterfly. No narration. Suitable for primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Butterflies are...
results.brief_description: Two students observe butterflies in their natural habitats in order to learn more about them. Contrasts the belief that insects can be studied by simple observation with the idea that it is necessary to kill and preserve insects in order to gain scientific knowledge about them. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Butterflies and nettles
results.brief_description: Documentary on the life cycle of the tortoiseshell butterfly: first laying their eggs under the leaves of sting nettles and in2-3 weeks the caterpillars emerge and live off the nettle leaves. Then fully grown caterpillars spin a chrysalis. After 3 weeks the new butterfly emerges, and so the cycle continues.

results.title: Buttercup
results.creator_credit: Robert Leland Brown and Dimension Films
results.brief_description: This film presents without commentary an ecological story about a buttercup which floats down a mountain stream and ends up being swallowed in polluted industrial waters. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Busy bodies
results.brief_description: Discusses how exercise and movement contribute to good health and physical condition. Shows characteristic movement of a variety of animals, followed by children imitating those movements. Narrated by Vic Perrin. Suitable for primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Bustin
results.brief_description: Internet comedy and meme-generator extraordinaire Neil Cicierega (Potter Puppet Pals) creates a video / audio remix of Ray Parker Jnr’s classic film theme that isn’t soon forgotten.

constellations_other.name: Dragon's Lair
constellations_other.description: A look at pop-cultural interconnections that spawn from the lair of Don Bluth's arcade classic.
